name: Mercy USA for Aid and Development
mission: Mercy-USA for Aid and Development is dedicated to alleviating human suffering and supporting individuals and their communities in their efforts to become more self-sufficient. Our philosophy is "Helping People Help Themselves".  Incorporated in the State of Michigan in 1988, Mercy-USA's projects focus on improving health, nutrition and access to safe water, as well as promoting economic and educational growth and providing disaster relief around the world.

rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1988</cite>, Mercy-USA for Aid and Development is a humanitarian organization dedicated to improving health, nutrition, and access to safe water for vulnerable populations globally. The organization is particularly distinguished by its <cite id="2">96.3% program expense ratio</cite>, which ensures that the vast majority of donor contributions directly fund field operations. Mercy-USA maintains a <cite id="3">92.33/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting high standards of accountability and transparency. Their primary operations focus on <cite id="4">nutrition support for children and mothers in Somalia</cite>, alongside significant emergency relief efforts in <cite id="5">Gaza, Yemen, and Syria</cite>. Beyond immediate relief, the charity invests in sustainable infrastructure, such as <cite id="6">rehabilitating cisterns to serve 10,000 people</cite> and constructing <cite id="7">950 modular homes</cite> for displaced families. As a <cite id="8">zakat-eligible</cite> entity, Mercy-USA provides a verified channel for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations through programs that serve the <cite id="9">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite>. Financially, the organization reported <cite id="10">$54,067,823 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, operating with an exceptionally lean fundraising model that costs only <cite id="11">$0.02 to raise every $1</cite>.
